meta.name: description
meta.content: To reduce the number of trips for parents and guardians, the Round Rock ISD Food Services Department will be transitioning meal distribution times to once per day starting on Tuesday, March 31.

meta.content: School Closure Meal Distribution Times To Transition to Once Per Day, Weekend Meal Service Set To Launch

To reduce the number of trips for parents and guardians, the Round Rock ISD Food Services Department will be transitioning meal distribution times to once per day starting on Tuesday, March 31.Â Beginning Friday, April 3, students will also be able to pick up meals from any location for Saturday and Sunday during that dayâs meal distribution time. Weekend meals for students will be available for pickup each Friday.Â

div.h1: School Closure Meal Distribution Times To Transition to Once Per Day, Weekend Meal Service Set To Launch

img.alt: School Closure Meal Distribution Times To Transition to Once Per Day, Weekend Meal Service Set To Launch

p.strong: UPDATE: This article includes newly released information from the Texas Department of Agriculture on acceptable methods of proof for child meal services if a child is not presentÂ

ACTUALIZACIÃN: Este artÃ­culo ahora incluye informaciÃ³n publicada recientemente por el Departamento de Agricultura de Texas sobre mÃ©todos de verificaciÃ³n aceptables para los servicios de comidas para estudiantes

div.p: To reduce the number of trips for parents and guardians, the Round Rock ISD Food Services Department will be transitioning meal distribution times to once per day starting on Tuesday, March 31.

With the time transition, children under the age of 19 can pick up lunch, as well as breakfast for the next day, from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. at the Districtâs campus-based meal distribution locations.Â In anticipation of the adjustment, students will be provided with breakfast for the following day during the lunch distribution on March 30. A list of meal distribution locations can be found on the Food Services Department website.
In an effort to serve more students within Round Rock ISD, two more meal distribution locations have been added to provide Monday through Friday service. These locations are:

li.a: Montelena Apartments, 2501 Louis Henna Blvd, Round Rock
Double Creek Townhomes, 2500 Louis Henna Blvd, Round Rock

div.p: Service for the Montelena Apartments location will be fromÂ 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. and service for the Double Creek Townhomes location will be from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m.Â Meal distribution will take place by the main office of each location.

Beginning Friday, April 3, students will also be able to pick up meals from any location for Saturday and Sunday during that dayâs meal distribution time. Weekend meals for students will be available for pickup each Friday.

As a result of a waiver approved by the U.S Department of Agriculture, children are no longer required to be present to receive a meal. However, as stated by the Texas Department of Agriculture, parents or guardians must provide proof for each child that qualifies for the meal service during each visit as Districts are required to verify the number. Acceptable methods of proof include an official letter or email from the school confirming the childâs enrollment, individual student report cards, attendance records from the parent portal of the schoolâs website, birth certificate, or student ID cards.
If parents or guardians are unable to provide documentation, the child must be present to receive a meal.
Please continue to visit Round Rock ISDâs COVID-19 web page for the latest information and updates. We will also provide information on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

Para reducir el nÃºmero de viajes para padres y tutores, el Departamento de Servicios de Alimentos de Round Rock ISD harÃ¡ la transiciÃ³n de los horarios de distribuciÃ³n de comidas a una vez por dÃ­a a partir del martes, 31 de marzo.

Con la transiciÃ³n del horario, los niÃ±os menores de 19 aÃ±os pueden recoger el almuerzo, asÃ­ como el desayuno para el dÃ­a siguiente, de 11:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. en las 11 ubicaciones de distribuciÃ³n de comidas situadas en escuelas del Distrito. En anticipaciÃ³n del ajuste, los estudiantes recibirÃ¡n un desayuno para el dÃ­a siguiente durante la distribuciÃ³n del almuerzo el 30 de marzo. Puede encontrar una lista de ubicaciones de distribuciÃ³n de comidas en el sitio web del Departamento de Servicios de Alimentos.

En un esfuerzo por atender a mÃ¡s estudiantes dentro de Round Rock ISD, se agregaron dos ubicaciones de distribuciÃ³n de comidas mÃ¡s para proporcionar servicio de lunes a viernes. Estas ubicaciones son:

li.a: Montelena Apartments, 2501 Louis Henna Blvd, Round Rock
Double Creek Townhomes, 2500 Louis Henna Blvd, Round Rock

div.p: El servicio para la ubicaciÃ³n de Montelena Apartments serÃ¡ de 11:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m. y el servicio para la ubicaciÃ³n de Double Creek Townhomes serÃ¡ de 12:00 p.m. a 1:00 p.m. La distribuciÃ³n de comidas se llevarÃ¡ a cabo en la oficina principal de cada ubicaciÃ³n.

A partir del viernes, 3 de abril, los estudiantes tambiÃ©n podrÃ¡n recoger comida para los sÃ¡bados y domingos en cualquier ubicaciÃ³n durante el horario de distribuciÃ³n de comidas de ese dÃ­a. Las comidas de fin de semana para los estudiantes estarÃ¡n disponibles para recoger cada viernes.

Como resultado de una exenciÃ³n aprobada por el Departamento de Agricultura de Estados Unidos,Â ya no se requiere que los niÃ±os estÃ©n presentes para recibir una comida. Sin embargo, segÃºn lo establecido por el Departamento de Agricultura de Texas, los padres o tutores legales deben presentar prueba de cada niÃ±o que califica para el servicio de comidas durante cada visita. Los mÃ©todos de verificaciÃ³n aceptables incluyen una carta oficial o un correo electrÃ³nico de la escuela que confirme la inscripciÃ³n del niÃ±o, boletas de calificaciones individuales del estudiante, registros de asistencia del portal de padres del sitio web de la escuela, certificado de nacimiento o tarjetas de identificaciÃ³n del estudiante.
Si los padres o tutores legales no pueden proporcionar documentaciÃ³n, el niÃ±o debe estar presente para recibir una comida.

Por favor, continÃºe visitando la pÃ¡gina web COVID-19 de Round Rock ISD para obtener la informaciÃ³n y las actualizaciones mÃ¡s recientes. TambiÃ©n proporcionaremos informaciÃ³n en nuestras pÃ¡ginas de Facebook y Twitter.
